intro: Kundmannia insulana, commonly known as the island kundmannia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showing a preference for well-drained soils. Kundmannia insulana has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in open, sunny areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
